title: How to Draw the White House

steps.headline: Draw a rectangle.
Divide the rectangle into 8 equal parts horizontally.
steps.description: These are guide lines, so draw these lines lightly. You will erase them later.

steps.headline: Divide the rectangle into three equal parts vertically.
Divide up the left and right sections into 8 equal parts vertically.
steps.description: These are all guide lines for the many windows of the White House.

steps.headline: Using the guide lines, draw windows in the illustrated areas.
Add 4 columns in the middle section, spread out evenly (shown in red).
Add 6 windows in between the columns, using the guide lines to make sure that they are the same size.
steps.description: Once this step is completed, you can erase the guide lines.

steps.headline: Add another rectangle and triangle at the top, as illustrated in blue.
Draw a rectangle that is half the height of the triangle.
Add lines on both sides to draw the trim.
Add the details and design elements, referencing an image of the White House.
Finish with color and a background if desired.
Start from step 4 from the previous section.
Draw two lines (shown in blue) two lines down from the top.
Draw a curved line connecting the two drawn lines.
Draw another curved line in between the two guide lines.
Draw another curved line just below the fourth line as shown.
Draw a trapezoid as shown, starting just below the second line from the bottom.
Add pillars where shown.
steps.description: Note that there is more space between the front two pillars than the back ones.

steps.headline: Draw two guide lines lightly, as shown in red.
Draw windows using the guide lines drawn in the previous step as the top line.
steps.description:
Note that every other window is a skinnier window. The windows on the farthest left and the farthest right are lined up with the pillars. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/f7\/WhiteHouseBack7.jpg\/460px-WhiteHouseBack7.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/f\/f7\/WhiteHouseBack7.jpg\/728px-WhiteHouseBack7.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":248,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"392","licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Draw rectangles at the bottom of each pillar, and draw a line down on the end pillars until the trapezoid.
Draw an angled line, connecting the inner corner of the end pillar rectangle bottoms to the line as shown.
Draw stairs as shown.
Extend the guide lines (shown in red) drawn in step 8 to the edge (shown in blue)
Using the guide lines for the top line, create more windows.
steps.description: Note that if you later want to add trees in front, some of the windows may be covered up.

steps.headline: Draw a line on either side of the pillars on the first line as shown.
Draw a curved line, connecting the two drawn lines in the last step.
Draw additional details, such as the flag, window details, and lines.
If desired, add color using markers, paints, colored pencils, or other materials.

text:
North Lawn Draw a rectangle. Divide the rectangle into 8 equal parts horizontally. These are guide lines, so draw these lines lightly. You will erase them later. Divide the rectangle into three equal parts vertically. Divide up the left and right sections into 8 equal parts vertically. These are all guide lines for the many windows of the White House. Using the guide lines, draw windows in the illustrated areas. Add 4 columns in the middle section, spread out evenly (shown in red). Add 6 windows in between the columns, using the guide lines to make sure that they are the same size. Once this step is completed, you can erase the guide lines. Add another rectangle and triangle at the top, as illustrated in blue. Draw a rectangle that is half the height of the triangle. Add lines on both sides to draw the trim. Add the details and design elements, referencing an image of the White House. Finish with color and a background if desired. South Lawn Start from step 4 from the previous section. Draw two lines (shown in blue) two lines down from the top. Draw a curved line connecting the two drawn lines. Draw another curved line in between the two guide lines. Draw another curved line just below the fourth line as shown. Draw a trapezoid as shown, starting just below the second line from the bottom. Add pillars where shown. Note that there is more space between the front two pillars than the back ones. Draw two guide lines lightly, as shown in red. Draw windows using the guide lines drawn in the previous step as the top line. Note that every other window is a skinnier window. The windows on the farthest left and the farthest right are lined up with the pillars. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/f7\/WhiteHouseBack7.jpg\/460px-WhiteHouseBack7.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/f\/f7\/WhiteHouseBack7.jpg\/728px-WhiteHouseBack7.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":248,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"392","licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"} Draw rectangles at the bottom of each pillar, and draw a line down on the end pillars until the trapezoid. Draw an angled line, connecting the inner corner of the end pillar rectangle bottoms to the line as shown. Draw stairs as shown. Extend the guide lines (shown in red) drawn in step 8 to the edge (shown in blue) Using the guide lines for the top line, create more windows. Note that if you later want to add trees in front, some of the windows may be covered up. Draw a line on either side of the pillars on the first line as shown. Draw a curved line, connecting the two drawn lines in the last step. Draw additional details, such as the flag, window details, and lines. If desired, add color using markers, paints, colored pencils, or other materials. And you are finished!
